II. An Abstract of the <u>Meteorological Diaries<\u> 
com[m]unicated to the <u>Royal Society<\u>, with Remarks 
upon them by <u>W. Derham D.D.<\u> Canon of <u>Wind
sor<\u> & F.R.S. 
part.II. containing, Part I.vid. Transact[ions] 
no. 423. 
A journal containing <u>Meteorological Observati-
ons<\u> made at <u>Petersburgh<\u> by the <u>Rev<sup>nd<\sup> M<sup>r<\sup> 
Tho: Consett<\u> from Nov.24.1724 to Jun.
23.1725. Abstracted for the use of the R.S. 
by <u>W. Derham<\u> F.R.S. 

This journal contains Observations, 
three times in the day, of the Barometer, 
the Winds & their strength, the Weather, 
& (after Apr.15) of the Thermometer. Which 
Observations (although very curious & use-
full) yet being too long <s>for, &<\s> would be 
tedious to read at the Societies Meetings. 
I therefore desire the following extract 
may be acceptable. 
<u>M<sup>r<\sup> Consett<\u> <s>notes<\s>, from the beginning, noteth down the 
Barometrical Variations, but I know not 
his Divisions, & Degrees, till Dec.18, at 3<sup>h<\sup>.p.m, 
& then the Barom<sup>r<\sup> was at 30c66, Wind NE<sup>1<\sup>, 
& Fair. 
From Nov<sup>r<\sup> 24 to the end of y<sup>t<\sup> Month, 
the Weather was Cloudy, W<sup>th<\sup> Snow, & a deep 
Snow
